titleStmt.title: J. G. Morrison to James F. Robinson
CWG8000

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: No Election was held in the Newtown District No 8. Scott County on the first Saturday in May last, for Justices of the Peace. Consequently there is now a vacancy in Said District. John McMeekin & Rice H. Parks have filled the offices of Justice of the Peace for some years and are as good men I suppose as any in the District and well qualified, I would therefore recommend to your Excellency their appointment till the first Monday in August next, if you think of no others that you would prefer to Commission,

Very Respectfully
J. G. Morrison Pr J S C

Scott Co
J. P.
Dist No 8
Comn Issd June 2. 1863
